name: Jonathan Greenblatt

text: Today would have been the 90th birthday of Anne Frank. When she turned 13, she was gifted the diary that has since been read by millions. Honor her courage, her memory and her work and #NeverForget why we must always fight the #hate that threatens us all.

text: Three years ago, 49 lives were taken at Pulse nightclub in an attack fueled by hate. An entire community was changed forever that night. Our thoughts are with the victim's friends, families & the #LGTBQ community, which we continue to stand with and fight for.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Here's what we've recommended they do now: - Commit to reviewing policies/ practices to prevent publication of such slander. - Provide staff training on #antiSemitism. - Publish a detailed breakdown of #antiSemitic myths for readers' benefit.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Here's what we've recommended they do now: - Commit to reviewing policies/ practices to prevent publication of such slander. - Provide staff training on #antiSemitism. - Publish a detailed breakdown of #antiSemitic myths for readers' benefit.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: And to come on the same day a man attacked a synagogue because he believed such myths - this was not simply a management misstep but a moral failing of major proportions. The @nytimes owes the Jewish community more than an apology. We need accountability and action.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Heartbroken by the scene at #NotreDameCathedral. It's truly devastating to see one of the most historic & important houses of worship in flames. Our hearts are with Paris, the Catholic community, and everyone who has a connection to this beautiful landmark.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: We welcome @UNESCO's unequivocal condemnation of the anti-Semitic Aalst carnival float, especially as the festival promotes itself as UNESCO-recognized cultural heritage.//t.co/dhTJNimBgz

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Accusing Jews of allegiance to a foreign gov't is an age-old anti-Semitic trope used to persecute Jewish people. Our CEO @JGreenblattADL explains why combating #hate means calling out Ilhan Omar & any elected official who uses #hateful rhetoric. @USAToday//t.co/F5ekxk4lcl

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: (4/4) But words matter. When prominent people use anti-Semitic rhetoric, it greenlights more of it. That's why we've called out elected officials in both parties when they spew hate. Congress must send a clear, unambiguous message: there is no place for anti-Semitism in the US.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: (3/4) Islamophobia, anti-immigrant hate, racism & homophobia are scourges that plague our society. @ADL fiercely opposes such bigotry, including when recently directed @IlhanMN. We unequivocally oppose targeting her or anyone in the Muslim community on the basis of faith.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: (2/4) Trying to make this situation about Israel is a tactic to deflect from the central issue of anti-Semitism. It is a move we have seen, for instance, repeatedly in Europe and other countries. It is wrong plain and simple.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: A thread on the controversy around @IlhanMN's comments: The problem isn't that she criticized Israeli policies. The problem is that she has repeatedly used age-old anti-Semitic tropes that have marginalized & persecuted Jews for centuries, before Israel even existed. (1/4)

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: White supremacist propaganda increased by 182% over the last year -- This is not a movement in decline. They are simply changing the ways they spread their #hate. ADL expert Cara Hill writes on this topic in @Politico.//t.co/EO5OC0EsTq

name: Jonathan Greenblatt

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Words have consequences. It's time for responsible leaders from across our society to step forward & clearly denounce this hate. It is time more people of all faiths & ideologies to speak out clearly & forcefully against racism, scapegoating, & bigotry in our national elections.

text: From immigrants being scapegoated to racist robocalls against African-American candidates to swastikas painted on Jewish candidates' campaign signs and political ads pushing racist and anti-Semitic buttons, this election season has hit a new low.

text: Today is a day of celebration as the US Embassy opens in Jerusalem. The choice of Pastor Robert Jeffress to offer a prayer sends exactly the wrong message. Jeffress has a history of bigoted comments about LGBTQ people, Jews, Muslims, Christians and other religions.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: On this day as we honor new US Embassy, all should celebrate that it's the capital of a Jewish state that respects Christians, Muslims, Mormons, LGBTQ + other minorities. What we need now are prayers of hope, openness & respect for all as well as peace for all people.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: There are many challenges in a world in increasing disarray but blaming @NYTimes for reporting on Iranian aggression or to suggest that Iran is misunderstood when we review their history & watch them implement their stated objectives, is illogical at best, biased at worst.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Finally if you read reports from inside Iran about ongoing protests, you learn about widespread discontent of Iranian people bc the regime has pursued an expansionist agenda abroad and de-prioritized the needs of its own citizens. Some empathy for them?//t.co/Xvxi4tk3oj

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: I'm not even touching on many incendiary threats that Khomeini himself, let alone Khameni, have issued ag other govts in MidEast, esp House of Saud. Bet you won't hear much about such outrageous behaviors this week as Iran's apologists demonize Saudi Arabia ahead of MBS visit.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: These are not one-time statements motivated by short-term thinking. These are strategic, inspired by a revolutionary creed that is grounded in waging war ag Jewish state, not only in recent years but since 1979. Would author say that justifies proactive Israeli action ag Iran?

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: What is lacking is any consideration for Israeli civilians who now live kms away from these brutal, homicidal militias. And if we want to see things from all sides, how should Israel perceive the country whose leaders routinely dehumanize Jews + call for genocide ag Israel?

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: The piece talks about cognitive empathy. But it lacks any perceptible empathy, cognitive or otherwise, for 500k Syrian civilians killed, 5M+ cast into exile bc of Iran & it's terror proxies who have built their sphere of influence on the ashes of a pluralistic UN member-state.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: I'm loathe to even QT this article bc its wrong on many levels but still want to point out the bizarre claim that @nytimes is increasing odds of a conflict in MidEast when it **accurately** reports on presence of Iranian terror militias on Israel's border//t.co/LgB6QADfQv

name: Jonathan Greenblatt

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: 5/7 I went to #Auschwitz and traced the tracks, felt my heart break in the barracks and said a silent kaddish in the gas chambers. This Nazi death camp operated 24/7/365, it's furnaces belching out the ashes of Jewish Europe on the Polish residents of the nearby eponymous town.//t.co/7pZNyfuY9u

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: 4/7 I went #Jedwabne to honor the hundreds of Jews, killed by their Polish neighbors in 1941. I stood on the hallowed ground where these Jews were herded into a barn and burned. They were murdered by Poles, not by Germans. They were massacred by their neighbors, not by Nazis.//t.co/Ou87xC8glR

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: 3/7 I went to #Warsaw 2 yrs ago, walking the confines of the ghetto where Nazis packed Jews after tearing them from their homes, starving them before sending them off to be murdered. And as the Jews vanished, Polish citizens claimed those emptied homes and settled those streets.//t.co/6Q6tQmVUSW

name: Jonathan Greenblatt

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: @POTUS Synagogues firebombed, Jewish-owned shops attacked, Israeli flags burned, anti-Semitic slogans chanted. These are just some of the reactions globally and in the U.S. to President Trump's announcement that the U.S. was recognizing Jerusalem as Israel's capital.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: @POTUS Disgraceful comments by Turkish President Erdogan reacting to U.S. recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital: Palestine has been under uninterrupted occupation since 1947. He also called Israel an occupying state and terrorist state and a country that kills children.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: Since @POTUS's #Jerusalem announcement, ADL has been monitoring anti-Israel and anti-Semitic protests and incidents across the US and in cities around the world. See our new blog highlighting some of the most egregious examples.//t.co/HxvLHxBrHI

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: #OTD 62 years ago, Rosa Parks, a friend to ADL, changed the landscape of American civil rights by refusing to give up her seat & insisting she be afforded the rights she deserved. Her courage, leadership, & dedication will never be forgotten. We all owe her a debt of gratitude.//t.co/3zZDMd3f2j

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: @POTUS (2/2) We have seen a clear line from advocating intolerant ideas to pushing out prejudiced memes to introducing anti-immigrant & anti-Muslim policies like #TravelBan. We stand with the Muslim community and with all those condemning this shameful message.

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: It is no longer alarming that our @POTUS is tweeting violent anti-Muslim videos created by far right extremists - it is a **four alarm fire.** Of course this will embolden bigots in the US and abroad. (1/2)//t.co/PxpvhyWyud

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: ADL is committed to fight #antisemitism & all forms of bigotry + to seek civil rts 4 all. We do so, not by embracing extremes, but by combining principles & pragmatism. This is #TheGoodFight. We welcome all - young & old, right & left, Jewish & non-Jewish - to join the fight. 4/4

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: ADL is committed to fight #antisemitism & all forms of bigotry + to seek civil rts 4 all. We do so, not by embracing extremes, but by combining principles & pragmatism. This is #TheGoodFight. We welcome all - young & old, right & left, Jewish & non-Jewish - to join the fight. 4/4

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: We lose in an envmt where extremes dominate. We need a strong center grounded in values, enriched by traditions + a willingness to learn. We must elevate ppl of all generations & remember - "If I am not for myself, who will be for me? But if I am only for myself, who am I?" 3/4

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: There should be a tolerance for fierce debate but also civil discourse; for expressing strong opinions without resorting to slurs; and for engaging on issues without bullying those with whom we disagree. From this moment, we must all commit to doing better. 2/4

name: Jonathan Greenblatt
text: As we approach #Shabbat, I cannot help but reflect on a series of painful exchanges & ugly incidents that took place this past week -- in America, in Israel, on Twitter. IMO they demonstrate warning signs of sinat chinam in the Jewish community. 1/4
